body:
Hi @ToddBear!

 Try this, it's just a sample:

```
def remove_obj_from_environment(obj, comm, scene):

    _, graph = comm.environment_graph() 

    ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes']]
    obj_ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes'] if node['class_name'] == obj]
        
    for obj_id in obj_ids:

        if obj_id in ids: 

            nodes_to_remove = [node for node in graph['nodes'] if node['id'] == obj_id]
            for node in nodes_to_remove:
                graph['nodes'].remove(node)

            edges_to_remove = [edge for edge in graph['edges'] if edge['to_id'] == obj_id or edge['from_id'] == obj_id]
            for edge in edges_to_remove:
                graph['edges'].remove(edge)
            
            success, message = comm.expand_scene(graph)

```

Hi, kswain98

I successfully remove objects from the scene using your codes.

Thank you very much!
Hi @ToddBear, Happy to help! Feel free to reach out if you have any other questions!

Hi, kswain98, I just had some problems...
When I remove the objects like 'chair', 'sofa', 'television' or even 'wall', it works successfully.
However, the removal of 'computer' seem to fail ...

The follwing codes is modified from "/demo/generate_snapshot.py"

```
def remove_obj_from_environment(obj, graph):
    # _, graph = comm.environment_graph()
    ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes']]
    obj_ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes'] if node['class_name'] == obj]
    for obj_id in obj_ids:
        if obj_id in ids:
            nodes_to_remove = [node for node in graph['nodes'] if node['id'] == obj_id]
            for node in nodes_to_remove:
                graph['nodes'].remove(node)
            edges_to_remove = [edge for edge in graph['edges'] if edge['to_id'] == obj_id or edge['from_id'] == obj_id]
            for edge in edges_to_remove:
                graph['edges'].remove(edge)
            # success, message = comm.expand_scene(graph)
    print("Removal Finished {}:{}".format(obj, len(obj_ids)))
    return graph


def obtain_snapshots(graph_state_list, reference_graph, comm):
    _, ncameras = comm.camera_count()
    cameras_select = list(range(ncameras))
    cameras_ids = [-6, -5, -1]
    cameras_select = [cameras_select[x] for x in cameras_ids]
    
    seed = random.randint(1,100)
    messages_expand, images = [], []
    for graph_state in tqdm(graph_state_list):
        comm.reset(0)
        comm.add_character()
        graph_state = remove_obj_from_environment("computer", graph_state)
        message = comm.expand_scene(graph_state, randomize=False, random_seed=seed)
        messages_expand.append(message)
        _ = comm.camera_image(cameras_select, mode='normal', image_height=480,  image_width=640)
        ok, imgs = comm.camera_image(cameras_select, mode='normal', image_height=480,  image_width=640)
        images.append(imgs)

    return messages_expand, images
```

The program is descripted as below:
```
[Walk] <living_room> (1)
[Walk] <bench> (1)
[Find] <bench> (1)
[Sit] <bench> (1)
[Find] <book> (1)
[Grab] <book> (1)
[Read] <book> (1)

```

The snapshots are shown blow:
![file57_1_3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43341135/156328002-0b5fd939-c400-4de5-9933-4933796f446d.png)

It is clear that the 'computer' still exists in the secene. 

Could you do me a favour to have a look and tell me how to fix this ?

Hi @ToddBear! I tried this code and the computer screen was deleted succesfully. Can you try it again using this code:

```
import IPython.display
from sys import platform
import sys
from PIL import Image
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

sys.path.append('../simulation')
from unity_simulator.comm_unity import UnityCommunication
from unity_simulator import utils_viz

import cv2
import copy 
from collections import defaultdict
from tqdm import tqdm


objs_to_remove = []


def get_objects_in_room(comm, scene, room):
    
    assert room in ['kitchen', 'livingroom', 'bedroom', 'bathroom']
    object_classes_in_rooms = []
    
    comm.reset(scene)
    _, graph = comm.environment_graph()
    room_ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes'] if node['class_name'] == room] 

    for room_id in room_ids: 
        room_object_ids = [edge['from_id'] for edge in graph['edges'] if edge['to_id'] == room_id 
                    and edge['relation_type'] == 'INSIDE']
        room_objects = sorted(list(set([node['class_name'] for node in graph['nodes'] if node['id'] in room_object_ids 
                            and node['category'] not in ['Rooms', 'Floor', 'Doors', 'Walls']])))
        object_classes_in_rooms.extend(room_objects)
    
    object_classes_in_rooms = sorted(list(set(object_classes_in_rooms)))
    return object_classes_in_rooms



def remove_obj_from_environment(obj, comm, scene):

    _, graph = comm.environment_graph() 

    ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes']]
    obj_ids = [node['id'] for node in graph['nodes'] if node['class_name'] == obj]
        
    for obj_id in obj_ids:
        flag = False 

        if obj_id in ids: 

            nodes_to_remove = [node for node in graph['nodes'] if node['id'] == obj_id]
            for node in nodes_to_remove:
                graph['nodes'].remove(node)

            edges_to_remove = [edge for edge in graph['edges'] if edge['to_id'] == obj_id or edge['from_id'] == obj_id]
            for edge in edges_to_remove:
                graph['edges'].remove(edge)
            
            success, message = comm.expand_scene(graph)
            
            flag = True

    
    
def obj_remove(objs_to_remove, comm, scene):

    comm.reset(scene)

    bathroom_objects = get_objects_in_room(comm, scene, 'bathroom')
    bedroom_objects = get_objects_in_room(comm, scene, 'bedroom')
    kitchen_objects = get_objects_in_room(comm, scene, 'kitchen')
    livingroom_objects = get_objects_in_room(comm, scene, 'livingroom')

    all_objects = sorted(list(set(bedroom_objects + livingroom_objects + bathroom_objects + kitchen_objects)))
    global_objects = [obj for obj in all_objects if obj in bedroom_objects and obj in livingroom_objects and obj in bathroom_objects 
                    and obj in kitchen_objects]

    bathroom_objects = [obj for obj in bathroom_objects if obj not in global_objects]
    bedroom_objects = [obj for obj in bedroom_objects if obj not in global_objects]
    kitchen_objects = [obj for obj in kitchen_objects if obj not in global_objects]
    livingroom_objects = [obj for obj in livingroom_objects if obj not in global_objects]
    

    all_objects_dict = defaultdict(int)

    comm.reset(scene)
    _, graph = comm.environment_graph() 
    for obj in all_objects:
        all_objects_dict[obj] += len([node for node in graph['nodes'] if node['class_name'] == obj])


    print('removing selected objects from the environment!')

    comm.reset(scene)
        
    for obj in tqdm(objs_to_remove): 
        remove_obj_from_environment(obj, comm, scene)

    print('process complete!')

```

Hi kswain98! I tried this codes you provided with the following codes.

```
from utils_demo import *
comm = UnityCommunication()
obj_remove(['computer'], comm, 0)
imgs_prev = get_scene_cameras(comm, [70,71,72,73])
display_grid_img(imgs_prev, nrows=1)
```
The results are shown below, where the computer screen is closed. It that means the computers are removed successfully ? 

![index](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43341135/156344556-ab1992c0-f96f-485e-a252-7c50b1c2610c.png)
Hi @ToddBear! Did you make sure to call the computer screen "cpu_screen"? And does the issue occur for any other environments?

Hi @kswain98 ! 

I'm sorry I misunderstood. I used to think that 'computer' represent the screen of the computer.   

Now I know 'cpuscreen' represent the screen, and I delete it successfully using your codes. 

Thank you very much!

Hi @ToddBear! No worries at all! Happy to help! If you you are planning to work on a project using VirtualHome, you can join the Discord channel and I can help you out if you have any further questions: https://discord.gg/f3U92kUu4b.
